msItem.title: Book of Hours, Use of Sarum
Hours of the Virgin with the Hours of the Cross and of the Holy Ghost worked in
msItem.note: Among the commemorations at Lauds are those of St Ethelburga and St Winifrid; some rubrics in French.

msItem.title: The Seven Verses of St Bernard

msItem.note: Penitential and Gradual (fol. 123v) Psalms with the litany (fol. 134)
Introduced by a long rubric (Femina quedam solitaria)

msItem.title: Devotion to the Seven Last Words, attributed to Bede
msItem.rubric: Incipit oratio uenerabilis bede presbiteri de qua ut fertur qui cotidie et deuote flexis genibus eam dixerit. nec dyabolus nec mali homines ei nocere poterint nec sine confessione morietur. et per triginta dies ante obitum suum uidebit gloriosam uirginem mariam in auxilio sibi preparatam
msItem.incipit: Domine ihesu christe qui septem uerba die ultimo uite tue in cruce pendens dixisti
msItem.explicit: Veni ut mecum sedeas cum angelis meis sanctis in regno meo epulari iocundari et commorari. Per infinita seculorum secula Amen.

msItem.title: Prayer with indulgence of Boniface VI
msItem.rubric: Cuilibet dicenti hanc orationem inter eleuationem corporis christi et tercium Agnus dominus papa bonifacium vius concessit duo milia annorum indulgentiarum ad supplicationem philippi regis francie
msItem.incipit: Domine ihesu christe qui hanc sacratissimam carnem tuam et preciosum carnem tuam et preciosum sanguinem tuum de gloriose uirginis marie utero assumpsisti
msItem.explicit: et ab uniuersis malis presentibus preteritis et futuris. Amen.
msItem.note: Cf. Hore beate virginis marie ad usum Sarum [Wolf. Hopyl?] Pro Anthonio Vérard, Paris 1503–5, fols. 17v-18r.

Letter(s?) of Christ to Abgar, mingled with devotions to Christ and the cross. (The divisions between the texts are uncertain, and some of the devotions may be intended as part of the letter(s).) For the letter cf. Stegmüller, Bibl. 147,1a; the text here is a longer version in which the letter is given apotrophaic powers; cf. D. C. Skemer, Binding Words: Textual Amulets in the Middle Ages (2006) pp. 96–105.

msItem.rubric: (fol. 252r) Hec est epistola manu saluatoris conscripta regi indie abagaro per angelum erat transmissa ut in legenda aurea asseritur et uallet contra omnes impugnationes tam spirituales quam corporales
msItem.incipit: (fol. 252r) Hec est epistola domini nostri ihesu christi quam manu sua scripsit mittens per angelum ad agabarum regem indie
msItem.explicit: (fol. 252v) nec alique alia creatura ei nocere potent illo die

msItem.incipit: (fol. 252v) Crux christi sit semper mecum Crux christi est quam adoro
msItem.explicit: (fol. 253r) Crux christi sit semper ante me post me quia antiquus hostis fugit ubi uidet te
msItem.note: Similar to the text pr. in Reliquiae Hearnianae, ed. P. Bliss, I (1857), 196–7

msItem.rubric: (fol. 253r) Hic incipit alia epistola domini nostri ihesu christi quam manu sua scripsit ad agabarum regem indie dicens
msItem.incipit: Hec est epistola mea beatus es agabar rex qui in die me non uidisti et in me credidisti
msItem.explicit: (fol. 253v) et saluus ens in ciuitate in domo in uia in agro in mare et ubicumque fueris

msItem.incipit: (fol. 254r) Benedicat me imperialis maiestas Protegat me regalis diuinitas
msItem.explicit: (fol. 254r) saluus et protectio In nomine patris et filij et spiritus sancti Amen
msItem.note: Largely as pr. Horae Eboracenses, p. 88.

msItem.incipit: (fol. 254v) O bone ihesu o dulcissime ihesu o piissime ihesu
msItem.explicit: (fol. 256r) et omnes qui diligunt nomen tuum quod est ihesus
msItem.note: Cf. the text printed Leroquais, Livres d'Heures, II.345.

msItem.incipit: (fol. 256r) Posui deum adiutorem meum. Dominus michi adiutor non timebo quid faciat mihi homo. Illumina domine oculus meos neunquam obdormiam in morte
msItem.explicit: (fol. 256v) et improuisa morte et ab omnibus periculis me defendat. Amen.

msItem.title: Fifteen Joys of the Virgin, in French
msItem.note: Sonet, no. 458; cf. text pr. Leroquais, Livres d'Heures II.310–11.

msItem.title: Seven Requests to our Lord, in French
msItem.incipit: Dous dieux dous pere sainte trinite vn dieu biaus sires dieux ie vous requier conseil et aide
msItem.explicit: et me octroie par ton plaisir que ie puisse confes morir. Pater noster.
msItem.note: Sonet, no. 504; cf. text pr. Leroquais, Livres d'Heures II.309–10.

decoDesc.summary: Fine miniatures, borders, initials. By the Fastolf Master. (Pächt and Alexander i. 670, pl. LIII)
decoDesc.decoNote:
The miniatures are as follows (full page unless otherwise noted).
Calendar, fols. 1–12: two small rectangular minitures at the foot of each recto, depicting (left) the labour of the month and (right) the Zodiac sign.
Fol. 23v, Hours of the Virgin, Lauds: the Visitation. The miniature of the Annunciation which originally preceded Matins is now Birmingham, City Museum and Art Gallery, P. 155'55a.
Suffrages (3/4 page):
Fol. 35v, The Trinity
Fol. 36v, The Holy Spirit (Baptism of Christ)
Fol. 37v, The Cross (Crucifixion)
Fol. 38v, St Michael
Fol. 39v, John the Baptist
Fol. 40v, John the Evangelist
Fol. 41v, SS Peter and Paul
Fol. 42v, St Andrew
Fol. 43v, St Stephen
Fol. 44v, St George
Fol. 46v, St Lawrence
Fol. 47v, St Eustace
Fol. 48v, St Christopher
Fol. 49v, St Sebastian
Fol. 50v, St Nicholas
Fol. 51v, St Anne
Fol. 52v, St Mary Magdalene
Fol. 53v, St Katherine
Fol. 54v, St Margaret
Fol. 55v, St Ethburga
Fol. 56v, St Winifred
Fol. 58v, All Saints
Fol. 59v, Peace (Noah's ark and the rainbow)
Fol. 62v, Hours of the Cross, Matins: Betrayal and arrest of Christ
Fol. 64v, Hours of the Holy Spirit, Matins: Pentecost
Fol. 66v, Hours of the Virgin, Prime: Nativity
Fol. 72v, Hours of the Cross, Prime: Christ brought before Pilate
Fol. 74v, Hours of the Virgin, Terce: Annunciation to the Shephers
Fol. 79v, Hours of the Cross, Terce: Flagellation
Fol. 81v, Hours of the Virgin, Sext: Adoration of the Magi
Fol. 85v: Hours of the Cross, Sext: Carrying the Cross
Fol. 87v: Hours of the Virgin, None: Presentation in the Temple
Fol. 91v: Hours of the Cross, None: Crucifixion
Fol. 93v, Hours of the Virgin, Vespers: Flight into Egypt
Fol. 100v, Hours of the Cross, Vespers: Deposition
Fol. 102v, Hours of the Virgin, Compline: Coronation of the Virgin
Fol. 111v, Penitential Psalms: David in penitence
Fol. 145v, Office of the Dead: funeral service
Fol. 188v, Commendation: burial
Fol. 217v, Psalms of the passion: mass of St Gregory
Fol. 231v, Psalter of St Jerome: St Jerome
Fol. 232r, Psalter of St Jerome: Christ crowned with thorns (half page)

binding.p: Purple velvet with gilt corner pieces, English, 16th century.

history.provenance: A kneeling figure of a man is in the miniatures of St George (44v) and St Christopher (48v), the male form of address occurs on fol.232v, but a female owner is suggested on fols. 61v, 232, and 247vs.
Henry VII (?): referred to as 'Henrici Septimi breviarium' by John Rouse in 1620 (Titus Livius Forojuliensis, ed. T. Hearne (1726), p. 201).
Henry VIII (?): traditionally said to have belonged to him (W. D. Macray, Annals of the Bodleian (1890), p. 468); binding resembles other Henrician manuscripts.
history.acquisition: Acquired before 1615, probably purchased between 1602 and 1605 with part of £50 given by lord Cobham.

recordHist.source: Description adapted (2018) from S. J. P. Van Dijk, Handlist of the Latin Liturgical Manuscripts in the Bodleian Library Oxford : Vol. 3: Books of Hours (typescript, 1957); Pächt and Alexander; and the Summary Catalogue (1922), with reference to other published sources cited in the description, and with additional description of textual content and decoration. Summary Catalogue, Vol. 2, part 1, p. 542

availability.p: To ensure its preservation, access to this item is restricted, and readers are asked to work from reproductions and published descriptions as far as possible. If you wish to apply to see the original, please click the request button above. When your request is received, you will be asked to contact the relevant curator outlining the subject of your research, the importance of this item to that research, and the resources you have already consulted.

Please note in addition that this item will be on display in the Bodleian Libraries exhibition "Write Cut Rewrite" (Treasury, Weston Library) from 29 Feb. 2024 to 5 Jan. 2025, and will not be orderable between those dates or for a short period before and after.
